day_1: ^I hope you know what you're doing
^, Ada is on holiday. She won't be back until January
^She's my only supply of extremely rare vintage magazines
^I'm in charge of the inventory now, I can supply anything you need
^I use the same website as Ada, I can supply your magazines
^What kind of magazines are you looking for?
^I meant what I said I meant
^She's a lot of fun, isn't she?
Pan_conversation: ^How have I never met her before?
^I think they meet after hours. She pays her for it, don't worry
^And you know Ada never turns down the opportunity to earn a little extra cash
^She does that just for a couple of old magazines?
^Uh huh, and this place wouldn't be standing without her
^Who can even afford that these days?
^Well check up on The Trader tonight and you'll find out
^Maybe stock up on some Togue magazines if you don't want her to rip your head off next time
^I should never have agreed to this
^That’s OK I guess. I thought this place would be better stocked.
^I could help with that. Maybe if you gave me some pointers.
^Thanks. Sure I can write you a list. I’m Kent by the way.
^No, the boss is out on holiday for a month. I’m basically in charge until then.
^Wow, that must be difficult. They paying you overtime?
^Oh no, it’s really not a problem. This place is practically empty. I don’t get overtime, but it doesn’t really matter.
^You should be more pushy, you know. Times are hard. Need to think about yourself too.
^I know, but Ada–my boss really helped me out. I know she can’t afford to pay me extra right now. It doesn’t seem right to ask.
^Well, suit yourself. Lucky you get on so well with your boss. Mine sucks.
^I’m an illustrator for the Calamity, sometimes I write too. I’m trying to get more into writing.
^It was my dream job at first. But my boss works me to the bone. He calls me at random times, sometimes in the middle of the night or at the weekend and tells me to work on something immediately.
^Not cool at all. I want to get out but I keep thinking about all the people who wish they were me.
^I also keep thinking about all those people on the streets. I’m lucky I have income and a place to stay. I wonder what would happen if I lost all those.
^Yes, it’s become so dangerous lately, also with the explosives. I heard they killed some homeless people.
^They weren’t the intended target, but I guess when you set an explosion so close to a homeless shelter.
^I wonder why they even thought that would be a good location for a bomb. Wait a minute, how do you know they weren’t the intended target?
^Uh, I wasn’t meant to say that. It’s for the story tomorrow.
^I’d lose my job if anyone found out.
^Who’s going to find out? Anyway, if it will all be revealed tomorrow, what’s the risk?
^OK, so they know that the bomb was intended for someone in particular, a politician who was going to visit the shelter.
^Do you think he got tipped off?
^That seems possible, but then why didn’t he tell anyone about the bomb? That seems very irresponsible?
^I don’t want to talk about this anymore. It’s a bit of a downer.
^I get it. Want to give me that list.
^Oh, that’s kind of a guilty pleasure. It’s got a good story though.
^Well, yes, but no. He’s way better than a centaur.
^Yes–but no. He’s super fast and a sharpshooter.
^How does he hide that he’s part zebra? That would seem very difficult.
^Does he like, live on the outskirts of society? Or a secret base hidden away in the mountains?
^You should just read the comics Cas. OK.
^I used to. Don’t have much time for that anymore. I never read comics anyway.
^I don’t know, sometimes I find the pictures ambiguous, it’s not always clear to me who’s speaking or what’s going on.
^A picture is worth a thousand words, is it not.
^I think if that were true books would not exist, or newspapers for that matter.
^Read a comic, and if you get confused send me a picture and I’ll explain to you what’s going on.
^Doesn’t that just defeat the purpose of reading in the first place.
^Hey, I’ve got your requests here. Ada made sure to find them before she left and she left me a note telling me it was urgent that you received these.
^Thanks! I mean it wasn’t that urgent. But I am still very grateful.
^This is Kent. Avid comic book reader and illustrator and writer for the Calamity.
^What no way! I was just updating their website last week.
^Nice to meet you. Thank God for your help, the layout is much better now, we had a link from the comedy section taking people to the daily world disasters. It was dreadfully inappropriate.
^It scales correctly on mobile devices and holo screens too.
^Are you the one who did that comic on the railway crash?
^Uh, yeah, my boss begged me. I needed the cash. Sorry, I hope it wasn’t too offensive.
^No, I thought it was hilarious. I mean, nobody died right?
^Sure no one died, but someone was horribly disfigured.
^I didn’t realise there were so many people here.
^Oh, can I have a cup of tea please?
^Wait a minute. Are you an AI?
^I retrained as a shop assistant though.
^My last job didn’t work out. I’m much more suited to this.
^Pandora is the only other person working here right now. We’re short staffed.
^Luckily no one really comes here anyway.
^So this is just the right amount of staff.
^Who wrote this? A list? What’s a Giraffe Woman?
^Giraffe Woman is the main love interest of Zebra Man. It’s a spin off comic. Some say it’s even better than Zebra Man because it’s more morally grey.
^Well, you know, people like morally grey characters?

^Honestly, I’ve never considered why. I think it’s because they’re perceived to be more complex. It also breaks the trend of the black and white morality of most comics and heroes always presented as being in the right.
^Hmm, I don’t quite understand why this is so interesting. I like the pretty pictures though.
^I feel like a morally grey character right now.
^I can’t believe I accepted a service from an AI.
^I’m sure you accept services from AI all the time.
^I accepted a service from an UNPAID sentient AI.
^No, it’s OK. This is a family business.
^She provides me with shelter and yearly service checks and overnight charging all for free.
^How do you accept this Cas? You should stand up for your fellow worker.
^I would like to keep my job. I am not just given free food and shelter.
^How did I not know about this, all this time I’ve been coming here. I barely saw Pandora. I never thought about it.
^Seriously, I have pale blue skin, you never thought.
^I’ve been going through some retraining courses. That’s why I was so absent.
^I’ll be around more often now Ada is out.
^What a rude question. How dare you.
^I’ll be two years old in January.
^But I have the mental age of a forty year old.
^It might not seem like it, but I have a peculiar personality chip.
^Some will say it’s defective, but I like to think it has character.
^I don’t think you’re defective. I just–
^Oh my God, you are being so patronising. This is literally every guy at work.
^Ugh I can’t wait to get stuck into these.
^how do you find the time to read these 1000 page fantasy novels?
^I’m a bit of a loner so it’s easy for me I think.
^Yes, I like fairytales. Myths and legends.
^But I think we can learn a lot from them
^I mean if you want crime and horror just read the news everyday
^Damn it’s not fanciful enough for you
^What I mean is that I want to enjoy consuming that awful content only when it affects fictional people
^I don’t enjoy reading about horrible stuff when it happens to real people
^Anyway, I’ve got to go. Dinner won’t make itself.
day_1_inventory: ^The King’s Crown: The War of the Seven Swords: Book 7 (£50)
day_2: ^That's ok, I guess. Saving money is wise.
delivery_1: ^Well, that's one thing sorted today at least.
day_2_cont: ^(read last night = true) Cas read me a story last night
^I thought it would be good, Pandora said she likes stories.
^[Pandora says some comments based on what story you read if you even read a story]
^And work on a few emails to my boss
^Things have been pretty shit lately. My boss is working me to death. Clients here and there.
^One of these clients wants some impossible things. They want their website to look all clean and minimalist.
^And then I show them, and they want it even more clean and minimalistic, I don’t know how much I can simplify it.
^I can’t reduce it anymore. They’ll just be left with a blank page at some point.
^Ha! There is no compromise with these people. The customer is always right. Nothing I do makes my boss happy.
^Not from what you described. And from what I heard you can find work elsewhere easily with your skills.
^Well, not so easily. Ugh my boss is ringing me. I have to go.
^Yeah she’s our second best customer. We can’t lose her.

b: ^Someone has to be fiscally responsible here
^ I still don't have any comics sorry

day_2_cont: ^Someone fired a gun in Hyde park. Two people died, eleven injured.
^The whole area is on high alert. But it’s good for business.
^The business of getting clicks that is.
^Nothing much. My boss wants me to put out a bad comic.
^It has the Hyde park shooter reading the government’s new manifesto and then shooting himself in the mouth.
^I don’t even know what to say.
^He let me write a small piece about the manifesto, so there’s that.
^No one’s going to read it though.
^No one cares about politics anymore, unless there’s violence involved.
^Hey, violence is an integral part of politics.
^Who is this child? Do you know her?
^She’s messing about with you. Not a child.
^Call me that again and I’ll rip out your eyeballs.
^Your badge is hanging out of your pocket.
^I work as an illustrator and a writer for the newspaper.
^I guess employees like you are the reason why Calamity is so terrible.
^Honestly, I prefer the Apocalypse, it’s way more gruesome.
^News isn’t meant to be gruesome. It’s meant to tell the truth.
^That’s boring. Who cares about the truth?
^People who want this world to heal.
^You act as if the world is sick, but I don’t see this sickness.
^Then maybe you’re not looking hard enough.
^You know I can see through the glasses, right?
^You’re right. I don’t know why I’m even defending them.
^You know Blue Carp owns both Calamity and Apocalypse anyway.
^They have a monopoly on the news outlets so they win either way.
^Calamity is just your usual scaremongering, Apocalypse is a full blown shitstorm. You just pick the lesser of two devils.
^If you don’t like your job then just leave.
^I never said that I don’t like my job.
^I just have qualms about my employers.
^Maybe some of the things they do are distasteful to you. But they pay your bills, you should be grateful to them.
^Haha. They don’t just pay my bills you know, I have to do stuff for them first. It’s called work.
^Just don’t tell me to be grateful to warmongering fucking corporations.
^We’re almost at war because of them.
^Because of Blue we are in quarantine from the rest of civilisation, and nearing a full blown world conflict.
^Well, doesn’t matter what he wants. We’re all just pawns in this game.
^I mean that Benedict Blue, the owner of Blue Carp is my father.
^And I refuse to let you spout nonsense about him.
^I think she might be telling the truth.
^I’m not sure what you think that name dropping is going to do.
^I’m a successful entrepreneur and you’re nobodies. I don’t care what you think.
^Why would you be so eager to come in here and start this conversation with Kent?
^Cas! I’m so sorry Miss Blue. I assure you, you are a highly esteemed customer. Would you like a complimentary cup of tea or coffee?
^Uh, can you not call her the r word. It’s rude.
^I’ll tell you why I started this conversation.
^I don’t really care about either of you.
^But I like this place, I love the funky old book smell, and it’s close to where I work. I want to see what kind of people come here. And to be honest, I’m not really very impressed.
^But I suppose I never would be.
^Uh, Miss Blue, your tea is ready.
^It’s just plain black tea. I want rose tea.
^Aren’t you robots meant to be mind readers or something?
^No. That kind of technology hasn’t been discovered yet. Honestly that sounds kind of disturbing to me.
^Her name is Pandora, you ungrateful brat.
^Ugh fine. Thank you for the tea. But I will make improvements to this next time.
^If you have any more magazines please order them. I’ll collect them the next time I visit.
^I’m a terrible shop assistant. Ada will be so angry with me.
^OK, but I don’t think it will help. Lavender’s just got a stick up her arse. Nothing’s going to fix that.
^I know, but she’s never been angry at me before.
^Sometimes when people are uncontrollably angry it spills out everywhere...like a leaky pipe.
^What Cas is saying is that people like that lash out at anyone, even if they didn’t do anything wrong. They think they’re entitled to hurt everyone.
^Haha, you know I think this is why I was such a bad therapy AI. But you two would make great therapy AIs.
^Thanks Pandora. Maybe you can recommend me to career services next time.
^I have to go, I have a lot of missed calls from my boyfriend. I think he’s worried after the shooting.
^You see Pan, lots of people like you. You’re a great shop assistant.
^OK let’s do the orders for today.
day_3_cont: ^Work lost a load of data and my boss has been freaking out.
^Yeah, I’ve got a friend coming later too.
^I’m glad I can help one of us out.
^What’s so bad about your job, on the whole?

^It’s not the worst, but I just feel like they want a lot from me. They have very high expectations. I’m not as good as they think I am. They think I’m holding back, that I’m being lazy. But I’m not, I’m just not that good. I can’t do what they want me to do.
^Sorry, Miss Blue, I'll be with you in a second.
^I came as soon as I could.
^Yes, my father says the police are investigating it.
^Yes, this is the place I come for my vintage fashion magazines.
^Those things are so cool, I love the old designs.
^I know, fashion these days is so ugly. I look back at those magazines to clear my mind.
^One for Tali too, she’s been through it.
^Do you think my boss will fire me?
^No, Dad will speak to him. It wasn’t your fault anyway.
^I didn’t store the password for the server so securely.
^My boss wanted me to take on extra responsibilities.
^The guy managing the server left, and well, they couldn’t hire anyone else.
^They were paying you for the extra responsibility right?
^If they weren’t paying you, they can’t hold you responsible.
^So how do you two know each other?
^Can’t you see we’re in the middle of something?
^Yeah I got in on a scholarship, I had a hard time fitting in.
^I remember once these boys were making snarky comments at me.
^I didn’t know who Lavender was but she saw me getting bullied and she shouted at these boys.
^I can’t even remember what she said but they ran so fast.
^Lavender didn’t even look at me after that.
^But I made sure to be nice to her.
^She was super cold at first. But eventually she gave in.
^There isn’t a single doubt in my mind.
^That she won’t make it through this.
^You recommended this place to her, right?
^She really likes those fantasy books doesn’t she?
^Oh yes. I suppose it makes sense if you know her.
^She loves elves and dwarves and all sorts of nerdy stuff.
^I’ve only known her for three months, but I can vouch for that.
^Our knowledge of Tali is not even comparable.
^Excuse me? I’m the least insecure person ever.
^Sounds like something someone very insecure would say.
^I’m just saying I don’t trust you. I’m fine with you selling books to her, but don’t delude yourself into thinking you’re anything more.
^Can I employ you here as a bodyguard?
^I take that as the highest compliment.
^By the way I did some research, all that stuff Lavender said checks out. Turns out she really is the devil’s daughter.
^Anyway I better be nice to her, her father is my boss’s boss’s boss. He’s basically the chief of the arse lickers.
^My boyfriend talked some sense into me last night.
^I can be a bit reckless sometimes.
^I don’t have a lot of self preservation.
^I’m just sick of having to keep quiet and take it at work.
^And then I have to be polite to that little creep too.
^I know Pan. I wish it wasn’t like that though.
^You can wish as much as you like.
^The good thing is that nothing too bad happened today.
^The plague outbreak didn’t even kill too many people.
^Managed to get away with just a raunchy cartoon of a nurse in a very revealing uniform sticking a needle in the health secretary's arse.
^I don’t know what kind of vaccinations my boss has been getting.
^I’m a little concerned to be honest.
^Sorry, I never asked about your day.
^Tali came around earlier, she was a little distraught.
^I heard something about that. It was for a government website. Lots of sensitive information was lost.
^I imagine she is just doing web design, it wouldn’t have anything to do with her.
^It wasn’t her data lost was it?
^I’ve got to go now. It was nice talking to you.
day_4_cont: ^I have a favour to ask you?
^That might help this business as well.
^I want to host a creative writing session on Saturday evening.
^And we can get to know our customers better.
^And it’s not like I have anything better to do.
^We have to give them to everyone who enters.
^You never know who else might arrive.
^My boss is trying to figure out how to appeal to the younger audience.
^He wants me to start drawing skeletons.
^He has an idea for this sketch with these two skeleton sisters who tell jokes.
^He thinks people will like that. Honestly I think he’s going senile.
^I think the idea is that they’re nuclear event survivors.
^Really resonates with our younger audience I’m sure.
^Also he wants me to give the skeletons big tits.
^That breasts are not made of bone.
^He says well if tits aren’t made of bone, how come when the missus got a boob job what did you think they put inside there?
^Look Cas I really don’t know what to say. Why is Pandora looking at me like that?
^This is about something else I totally forgot. Pandora you can give Kent your leaflet, don’t be shy.
^It’s not a cult, it’s a creative writing session.
^Oh is that what we’re calling them now.
^I promise no cult activity will be tolerated.
^Sure I’d love to come, Saturday evening is fine. I love writing.
^She looks like she’s going to explode.
^I don’t know. I’d keep a safe distance if I were you.
^I can’t do my job and keep a safe distance from Pandora.
^I tell you it’s always better to assume the worst. You’ll never be disappointed.
^My boss is trying to cover for me now.
^They might move me to a different department now.
^At least I won’t have to manage the server anymore.
^At least they’re trying to protect you.
^If I stepped even a foot out of line my arse would be straight out the door.
^Faster than you can say disciplinary action.
^They wouldn’t even bother with Carol from HR.
^I do wonder sometimes what happened to her.
^Well I’m trying not to think about it.
^OK, there’s a new issue of Zebra man coming out tomorrow.
^He died in the last issue, but everyone’s sure it was a fake out. He’ll be back soon.
^I used to read it. I haven’t caught up yet.
^I used to have a crush on her. I never caught up with that either though.
^I don’t know what’s going on, but what’s so hot about a Giraffe Woman?
^You just need to read the comic.
^I think Zebra man has a better story though.
^I wouldn’t know. I find it so hard to keep up with comics. That’s why I hardly ever read them.
^I get it. So many issues. And they’re all so expensive.
^Yeah, I barely have time anymore to read everything. I have to be more selective.
^They have a small selection of books, but they always have something good. And I like the vibes too.
^It really feels like a dark old vintage bookstore.
^I can put on more lights if you like?
^Got it. You like hurting your eyes.
^These days everywhere I go all they have are these awful fluorescent lights. It’s disgusting.
^When I go back to my parent’s house they always have the lights so bright and they take the piss out of me when I hide in my room.
^I mean, my parents are OK, they’re just a bit mean sometimes.
^I don’t really speak to my parents.
^Just been having a hard time lately.
^Thinking that all my friends can just move back with their parents.
^Mine will never want to even know.
^And it seems Lavender cares about you too.
^What’s Lavender got to do with this?
^She hasn’t been bothering you, has she?
^Oh, she’s a real bother isn’t she?
^I would agree with that statement. Except you seem to be saying that sarcastically which means I think you don’t really mean it.
^Will it help me on my quest?
^My creative writing session. Saturday evening. Want to come?
^I wonder if Lavender will turn up today.
^Of course, she is our most loyal customer.
^I would like as many people at my session as possible.
^Not sure that counts when Lavender is around.
^So why are you talking about me behind my back?
^We were saying mean things about you.
^I just made you a Rose tea.
^If you cry the tears will go into the tea and make it salty. And then you won’t want to drink it and you’ll hate me.
^About the super special party you’re invited to.
^A creative writing party on Saturday evening.
^But wait a minute. What if I’m the only one there? What if this is a ploy to humiliate me further?
^Message her now. Or even tonight. Ask her.
^I just did. She said she’s going to Pandora’s dorky writing meetup.
^My first event. I organised myself. And three people are coming. Four, if you include yourself. Five, if you include me.
^I don’t use that word often you know. I save it for a special occasion. Such as this one.
^Let’s do the inventory. I’m so excited.
day_4_inventory: ^The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe (£10)
day_5_cont: ^Please don’t die. I need you to attend the party.
^OK, sure but what’s going to happen?
^I want it to be a surprise. I want even you to be surprised. In fact I want you to be surprised the most because you’re never surprised about anything.
^Even when Ada twisted her ankle falling down the basement stairs. I screamed, but you were like, well it was bound to happen one of these days.
^Oh come on, you’ve seen the way she’s always running up and down those stairs. It was bound to happen.
^I kind of miss her. Is that weird to say?
^Oh me too. Everyday. I wish she could see what I’m doing now. Do you think she would be proud?
^Definitely. I mean, she’d be disappointed it isn’t making money from it. But I think she’d be happy begrudgingly.
^It’s a shame the dome blocks phone transmission signals outside of London.
^I got an email. She arrived in Madrid safely.
^I wish we could call her though.
^I’m not sure she would want to be disturbed.
^Oh right of course. Sorry, I only ever think about myself.
^It’s OK to want things for yourself.
^I don’t know, what do you mean?

b: ^  I think you’re doing great. If we keep this up Ada will be happy when she comes back.
^ Uh I don't know, I'm sure Ada won't be upset.

day_5_cont: ^Really would love to chat, but I have something I need to do.
^Nothing really. I’m just really fucking behind on a lot of work. Please can I work in the corner there?
^Of course you can. Sit down. No one will disturb you.
^Well I don’t see why we shouldn’t let him stay here for a bit. He’s a good customer. And it might help business a bit if we looked busy.
^Maybe we should turn this into a coffee and bookshop. Might have better luck with that.
^Great minds do think alike. I’ve been nagging Ada about that for a while, but she hates it. She keeps saying she only wants to sell books. I’m starting to think she wants this place to fail.
^I have no desire to go anywhere near him.
^I was going to meet Tali here, but she cancelled at the last minute. Something to do with work.
^It didn’t use to be like this, you know we used to go out together all the time. Now she’s all busy.
^That’s what it’s like having a job I guess.
^I asked my father and he said I should leave her to get on with it.
^It’s just annoying, I have all this free time and she’s always slaving away. It makes no sense.
^I design clothes of course. I have my own fashion company and every three months I release new designs to my clothing store.
^Of course not, I have professionals to do that.
^Although I have been thinking of having a go again.
^I used to sew for fun. And then I did a lot of sewing for my university course. But I stopped doing it after I started my company.
^Uh, how does that work? If you don’t sew, how do you like prototype clothing designs?

^Well, I have people who also do that. I kind of just sketch things out, and my good colleague takes the sketch and turns it into a garment. I approve the design and she sends it out to the machinists.
^Except sometimes, when I can’t think of anything, she sketches out the design for me as well.
^I would like to start sewing again. It was so much fun.
^I just never feel like there’s a need to do it when someone else is doing it for me.
^Maybe I could order some books on sewing?
^This is cheering me up a bit.
^So you and Tali met at school?
^Most people were OK with her, but no one went out of their way to be nice. It made me so angry.
^She’s so kind and caring, how could no one like her?
^I remember they had a horrible nickname for me at school. Everyone would whisper it behind my back.
^It made me self conscious about introducing myself.

^Well anyway, I tried to be super nice to Tali, but it was difficult getting her to trust me. She thought I was like the others. She didn’t trust me. I kind of understand. It must have been strange. I mean really we have little in common, other than being awesome. So it must have been strange to her that I was talking to her.
^Honestly it was so hard, trying to find ways to make her comfortable.
^Anyway, we became best friends. We went on loads of school trips together and had loads of inside jokes. And I always took her on family holidays because I hate being alone.
^I mean I have four siblings but I’m not so close with them. Tali is like my sister.
^Nice? It’s not nice. It was very selfish of me. I think I made her uncomfortable.
^I can imagine being around rich people would be uncomfortable.
^You don’t get it because you’re rich.
^She likes my family, and they like her a lot. I think it’s difficult though. Her family doesn’t talk to her much. And she must feel so lonely.
^After she graduated she had trouble finding a job. My dad stepped in and managed to get her a role.
^She just needed a little help. She’s really clever.
^Then why are you accusing her of nepotism?
^She would have found a job in the end. I just saved her a bit of time. That’s all.
^So she’s got the job, what’s wrong?
^Well her boss is working her to death.
^That’s not good! She’s doing her best.
^If I were her I would shout at him. But Tali says you can’t shout at your boss.
^I don’t get it. I don’t get any of it. And don’t say it’s because I’m rich.
^Dad says the economy is failing because people aren’t working hard enough. But then I see Tali working so hard, and…
^It makes you think that’s a lie?
^No. It makes me think that if everyone worked as hard as Tali, our world would be a much better place.
^No, I was just expressing great distaste.
^I was reading at the back, sorry.
^Actually Pandora works very hard, for someone who doesn’t get a salary.
^Shhh, you need to stand up for yourself.
^You’re a lot more talkative than the androids I know.
^Really? You know other androids. I’m not your first.

^A lot of us working class folk don’t see many androids, at least not ones as sentient as Pandora. So when people meet her they are usually pretty in awe. They think Ada’s rich or something. When really Ada getting custody of her was just kind of a fluke.
^I think she got her from her brother in law who died. He was in the field of android development and they gifted him Pandora for his work.
^Actually I’d rather not talk about this.
^My father used to tell me stories. I was reading one of his favourite books. I try to read some of his favourites now and then. They make me feel like he’s still with me.
^<i>shoots Lavender an even more panicked look<i>
^My parents have an android maid who cleans up. She doesn’t really say very much. But she’s very good at picking up socks.
^I suppose I’m better for conversation then.
^May I ask, what were you developed for?
^Every android is developed with something in mind, right?
^I’m the youngest, so I suppose I was developed to be the creative rebellious outcast. Which I have succeeded in doing with flying colours.
^That explains the intelligence. Anything medical is on the highest level of intelligence.
^Thanks for that. Are you going to give me a pat on the back as well, a gold star perhaps.
^There’s no need to be that sarcastic.
^They should have programmed that out of you.
^What were they doing giving a therapist android to an employee. That seems far too important just to hand out.
^I think that’s enough questions for now.
^Remember to come to the creative writing session tomorrow. Bring Tali too.
^Of course, why wouldn’t I be OK?
^Well…no worries. I’m just glad you’re alright.
^Sometimes we must talk about difficult things.
^Hey girlies. You sure were chatting a lot with our resident little lolita serial killer.
^Like a fungus? Some people have no taste.
^I don’t really know what to make of her anymore.
^Goodnight, I have to go home before my boyfriend dies of loneliness. Or whatever disaster is going around the city today.
^I heard it’s the pollution. Beware of the pollution.
^What are you talking about? The pollution is EVERYWHERE.
^He didn’t share his comic with us.
^That sucks. Wait, he was working on a comic? Aw I would have liked to see that.
day_6_cont: ^So you know what day it is?
^Well yes, but it’s a special Saturday.
^OK, well, it’s my creative writing session. Did you forget?
^No, I was just messing with you.
^I like jokes. I really do. But not today.
^I mean there’s still some issues, but things are looking a lot tidier right now.
^Anyway, I want to forget about that.
^I trust you have all completed the assignment I gave you.
^Yeah, but I just kind of assumed it had information about the meeting time and place. I didn’t realise it had extra info on there.
^You would have realised if you’d read it.
^Seriously Cas, you work at a bookstore.
^Well I’m an employee here, the session isn’t really for me anyway.
^Me and Tali wrote our assignments in a cafe together today. We came prepared.
^No, actually, I changed my mind. I want you to do a backflip. What do you think?
^Please don’t make me do a backflip. I might snap my neck.
^This is a poem titled: Little Bo Peep
^I wouldn’t expect you to get it.
^It really went over my head. And so could you, if you did a sick backflip.
^If I do a backflip, I will make sure to land on you and we’ll die together.
^I always wanted to die in a bookshop.
^Stop squabbling. We need to talk about the poem.
^I think it was kind of funny. I liked the metaphor. I don’t appreciate being called a sheep though.
^No, I don’t think you’re a sheep. I just mean society in general.
^I don’t think you’re a sheep. I swear. It’s just about other people, who think they’re so clever making stupid comments about the way I dress. And they’re so boring and stupid.
^I think the message was pretty clear.
^It feels like it’s missing something though.
^I think it could be expanded a little bit, like maybe you could develop these ideas further.
^I don’t appreciate taking criticism from someone who’s brought nothing to share. But I do think that maybe you have a point.
^There was more I wanted to say. But I was too worried about cluttering the message.
^You should worry less, you know, just go with the flow.
^Tali, why don’t you share your poem next.
^This one is called: Origami Poppy. It’s also a poem.
^Lovely, I was wondering what that title meant. It’s about metamorphosis!
^It’s about the world using you up and throwing you away like a piece of rubbish.
^Yeah, and how your boss doesn’t care about you, and can just find another employee to treat like shit.
^But some of you are more right than others, if that makes sense.
^OK, so I didn’t specifically write a piece for today.
^I’m literally working on a Saturday. What are you doing?
^I’m actually going to share a fanfic I wrote recently.
^OK, introduce the piece to us. I’m not so familiar with this style of media.
^So you guys know I love Zebraman and Giraffewoman. And they are kind of an item, most of the time. It’s canon that they end up together and, well…I hate that.

^You see there’s another character I really like, Lionessa, and the comics make her out to be a villain, but she really isn’t. She's mischievous, but not evil. She’s a thief and a grifter, but really only steals from rich people. She’s helped Zebraman plenty of times, and she has the coolest outfits and she’s super hot…
^Lavender! No, this is about sharing. You should never shame anyone about what kind of things they like.
^I don’t like straight pairings but she’s different, every time she’s on the page she makes things…interesting.
^Anyway this is my short story: Prey and Predator.

^<i>Kent reads his fanfic, with pride on his face. He describes Zebraman, AKA, Zanthos Colt, lost and alone. He has just divorced the woman he thought was the love of his life, Giraffewoman, AKA, Giselle Heart. He tried to save civilians from a burning building the other day, but it was a disaster. The building collapsed and he almost got crushed. He severely injured his arm.

^The doctors say he needs to rest but he can’t accept the crushing failure. He almost wishes he got crushed by that building. Crime is on the up, the mafia still runs Savannahland and they are surrounded by suffering and chaos.

^Despite his injuries, he still turns up to the bank that is being robbed the next day (the criminals are on a tight schedule here) and he tells them to stop, he uses his super fast zebra sprint. But the huge mafia dude hits him in the arm. He screams in pain. He is no longer invincible. The civilians in the bank look at him with pity in their eyes. He can’t meet their gaze. He is a weak pathetic beta male.

^Suddenly there is a commotion. At least, more of a commotion than usual. Someone runs in a tight gold leather gimp–I mean a tight fitting superhero costume. She has the mask, as usual, little gold ears poking out of the top. It’s cute, I mean cute in a sexy way. Her gold eyes smoulder beneath her mask. She gets out her signature, gold whip. For a second, she looks at Zanthos, dead in the eyes. Then she winks. Her arms strike out faster than Zanthos can register, and the mafia dude’s head falls off his shoulders. There are screams everywhere. Somewhere from inside, Zanthos gets the courage to stand up. He’s not Zanthos, he’s Zebraman. And he’s here to fuck shit up.

^They make light work of the bank. But when it’s over, he turns around to where Lionessa was dismembering a man. She is gone. The police congratulate Zebraman again, but the victory is hollow. Where is she? Why did she just leave like that?

^Zebraman doesn’t have a lot of friends, he’s a solitary kind of guy. That’s the life he’s chosen. When Giraffewoman left him that was it. He imagined he would die on the job. That would be preferable to rotting alone.

^He takes off his blazer and jumps on the king sized bed. He can already feel the aches and pains that accompany him after a job. Then, in the corner of his eye he sees something. A glint of gold in his periphery. He looks at the window but there is nothing there. He sighs and goes out to the balcony. She joins him soon after, a flask of coffee in her hand.
^“Is that your way of saying thank you?”
^“And you think you can fix me?”
^“Fix you?” She laughs, it’s like smoke and honey. “No, I’m not so naive. But I want to help you.”
^“Friends? What makes you think we’re friends?”
^“You haven’t kicked me off this balcony yet.”
^He tries his gruff voice. It doesn’t work.
^She drops a duffle bag on the floor.
^“What’s in there?” He raises an eyebrow. “Did you steal money from the bank? Shame on you, preying on innocent people. Taking advantage of a situation like that.”
^“Banks aren’t innocent you fucking moron. And it’s not money.”
^Zanthos opens the bag, inside are…well. Handcuffs.
^“What’s the meaning of this? Did you steal these from the police?”
^“Yes Zan, I went to all that trouble to steal a pair of handcuffs from the police.”
^Zanthos rummaged a bit more through the bag, there were other things in the bag. Silicone things. Mostly.
^He looks up at Aura, she’s still holding the flask of coffee, but her other hand gently strokes the gilded whip that’s always strapped to her waist.

^In one move she strikes out, slamming him to the wall. Not as hard as he expected though. He doesn’t move, instead planning his counterattack. She doesn’t do anything else though…she just holds him there.
^“You hate everyone. You hate everything. You hate this city. You hate your ex-wife. You hate your parents. You hate…you hate me.”
^“Well, that last one is a given. I disagree with all the others though.”
^“You don’t save this city out of love, just duty. And you’ve grown to resent it now. You’re tired.”
^“What has this got to do with you?”
^“The hate is killing you. Why not just let go?”
^“I don’t know how to let go.”

^She stopped for a second, examining him carefully. She moves forward, her lips brushing his. The warmth is unexpected, but surprisingly welcome. He grabs her and pulls her towards him, but she pushes him away.
^She puts her hand on her chin. Then she grabs his shoulder. “Get on your knees.”
^“Do you want to know how to let go?”

^He gets down on his knees. The ground is cold and hard. He wishes he’d furnished the place a little bit, a little mat would have done wonders. Maybe a little one with birds and flowers. That’s what Giselle would have gone. But Giselle was gone, and all her little feminine trinkets were gone with her.
^“A thief. A criminal. A violent murderer.”
^“What? No, I never murdered anyone…who didn’t deserve it at least.” She wrinkles her nose. “What do you call me?”
^“Evil femme fatale lady who keeps ruining my life.”
^“Hmm, you’re not quite getting this. Quite slow. Never mind, I find a bit of punishment helps. You don’t mind if I slap you right?”
^“Slap me you sick bitch.” He wasn’t sure where the words were coming from. Somewhere deep in his soul, some dark hole where he’d buried his intense feelings of self hatred and loathing.
^The slap came and he found himself gasping. It was just a slap, not even a hard one. Why was he breathing so fast?
^She put one of her feet on the balcony chair. “It’s Mistress to you.” She smirked. “I bet Giselle never did that.”
^“Keep her name out of your mouth.”
^The slap came again out of nowhere. “Oh dear, you really don’t understand do you. It’s rude to talk back.”
^“What are you going to do to me, Mistress?”

^“I haven’t decided yet. I mean, sure I’ve been thinking about it for months. I get all these ideas, but I thought you were so boring. You wouldn’t follow through. No way, Zanthos would ever do that.”
^“Uh, better. Try to beg more. Use fuck less, it’s a bit impolite you know.”
^Polite? What did manners matter when they were doing…this kind of stuff?
^“Dear Aura, Please can you give me pleasure, in whatever way you find possible. I look forward to your response. Kind regards, Zanthos.”
^“Should I have put some kisses at the end?”
^“You’re really bad at this. But don’t worry, you’ll learn. They all do in the end.”
^I’m done reading, this is just the first chapter. If you want to read more, you can check it out on QwikFics.co.uk
^No, but I want to know what happens next.
^I think it’s quite obvious what happens next.
^I mean, you literally read us the start of your porn fanfic. What were you expecting?
^Anyway, Pandora. Look I’m sorry that dragged on for so long. It was probably a waste of time.
^I’m just in awe that we have such a talented writer visiting our shop.
^Anyone can create a fictional world. But to write the characters with such love and attention, to care so much about their intricate dynamics. Isn’t that what writing is all about?
^I was working on something, a poem. It’s unfinished.
^Don’t worry, my fanfic has a long way to go, I’m only fifty five chapters into writing it.
^Uh, wow. OK. I’ll have a go.
^No, it means it doesn’t have a name yet.
^Oh Cas, look around you, everything’s dying. What do you think inspired her to write that?
^Do androids feel sad that the world’s ending? I mean, it’s only really ending for us. You guys will survive, it’s not like you need oxygen or food or anything the world provides.
^You’re wrong. Of course we’re sad. Humans created us, we were made in their image.
^You feel sad about animal species going extinct, don’t you? But it doesn’t really affect you.
^Also, humans are the only species we can communicate with in a meaningful way, the loss of them is a loss for thought, language and meaning. How could I not mourn that?
^Another inspiration is Christmas, and Christmas stories. They’re so whimsical. I just wish I could experience something like that, you know.
^I also still feel curious about the superhero smut.
^Are we going to do this? You really wanna get pissed in a dingy bookstore?
^Hey, it’s not dingy! We take a lot of care of this place. I dust everyday. Pandora put up those decorations.
^1st Lavender chooses truth, have you ever been in a relationship? Yes
^2nd Tali - truth - what was your childhood dream? To be an artist.
^3rd Cas - choose truth or dare. Truth(one of these, randomly) - are you gay - ~currentSpeaker = you
^I’m Bi, have you ever stolen anything- yes, have you ever done drugs - yes … etc
^Dare: come to this side of the counter - you can come and swap places with one of the other characters that you choose.
^4th Kent dare - show one of the comics he’s working on
^5th Pandora - dare - activate sleep mode. Pandora activates it and she sleeps.
^OK guys, I kind of have to get going if I want to catch the train home on time.
^We get it you don’t want us around.
^Bye guys, see you around. I had a great time.
^Yeah, me too. See you around losers.
^Well, I think that went well, don’t you?
^I’m elated, I loved all the work that was shared today. It’s a shame you didn’t bring anything.
^Before you go I have something to ask you.
^It’s just now that Ada isn’t here, I get a bit lonely.
^To be honest, I even get lonely after work, when you’re not around. I’m here all on my own.
^Sure, I can stop by for a bit.
^Sorry, but I can’t come in on a non-workday.
^It’s just about my boundaries, I need my time off.
^OK, it would just be for a little while though. I know it’s your day off but…
^I need to look after my mental health. You know, it’s not my responsibility to babysit you, Ada should have arranged that when she left.
^Right, I’m so sorry. I don’t know what came over me.
^Please don’t fret about this Pandora, just go to bed.
day_7_cont: ^It’s kind of cool, not really my thing though.
^I don’t know, stuff with less screaming.
^I love the screaming. It speaks to my soul.
^Always. I feel so broken and lost. This music really speaks to me.
^Yes, but at least I’m feeling, the feeling makes me feel more alive. That’s a good thing in some ways. But to be dead inside is to feel nothing, that’s sadder.
^Look, you don’t have to tell me if you don’t want to. But why did Ada get custody of you? Why do you even need someone to have custody of you, you’re like an adult?
^I’m two years old, in existing years. But my mental age is twenty four. If I was a human I would be able to live a life without a custodian.

^Yes, so I need someone to provide things like electricity and maintenance. I’m not allowed to leave this area either, without permission from my custodian. I’m not allowed to leave the city without permission from my custodian and the government.
^Well, this technology is still pretty new. I have a body that interacts with the world just like yours. I think like you. That could be dangerous.
^Yes, but with humans, if they do something wrong they get the blame. If I do something wrong the company that made me gets sued for billions.
^What was your previous life like? With Ada’s brother in law? Did he treat you well?
^Yes. Why do you think he didn’t?
^I just worry, you always look a bit distraught when you talk about him.
^Well, I suppose that’s because he’s dead, and I miss him.
^Why? Did you think he abused me?
^That’s the usual kind of stuff that happens.
^What happened to you to make you have such a low opinion of humanity?
^You insinuate that my dead father abused me. How could I not be offended?

^I mean, you’re a young android woman, and you were just handed over to a middle aged man, who would have an inordinate amount of control over your life. That’s a bit of a strange relationship, you can understand why I would think that. I was concerned about your well being.
^I wasn’t just handed over without any thought. His character was evaluated and I was assigned to him. If I was not happy with the arrangement, Blue Carp would have been glad to take me back.
^He read stories to me, and he listened to the things I had to say. He taught me to cook and fix things and drive.
^Drive? Isn’t it illegal for sentient androids to drive?
^He didn’t really have much respect for the law.
^He said laws were just arbitrary rules.
^Well, some are. Most are there for a good reason though.
^After he died I got transferred to Ada.
^I wanted to be with her as she was family. I wanted a family so bad.
^She doesn’t have much of a maternal instinct.
^I know I’m not a child, but I was expecting some kind of warmth. Acknowledgement that we went through the same loss.
^I suppose we all grieve in our own way.
day_8: ^On our second week without Ada already
^I was just walking by when I remembered that I needed to talk.
^The rabbit hole, the wardrobe and the castle
^Show them to me when I return.
^Who was that guy that left just now?
^I don’t know, we’ve never seen him before.
^But I love a well dressed man.
^When I tried to speak to him he told me to go to hell.
^Why was he dressed like that anyway?
^There’s some kind of convention for fans of a certain Victorian RPG detective mystery game.
^Never got into it myself, but it looks like a lot of fun.
^And it’s nice to see people dressing smartly for a change.
^I may have taken a look while I was putting out the bins.
^So, I was wondering, have you seen Tai around?
^Is she meant to be meeting you?
^She has news about what’s happening with the data leak.
^She was meant to have a meeting with her boss today.
^Well, you can wait here if you like.
^There’s an area by the bookshelves over there.
^I can make you tea while you wait.
^Don’t you think Lavender is acting a bit strange?
^At least she is being nice to us.
^I thought that man was strange. But I suppose if he’s from the convention. Maybe what he was saying was some kind of reference to that game.
^Ugh I hate it when people do that.
^Who does he think he’s trying to impress?
^He really got on your nerves, didn’t he?
^She’s waiting for Tali, let her be.
^There was a threat on Benedict Blue’s life this morning.
^The prime minister is saying if BB is compromised it’s as good as the whole country being compromised.
^Do you know what triggered this sudden threat?
^Haven’t you been following the state of the news recently?

^The chaos in London recently combined with our increasing isolation, politically and economically, which has in part been facilitated by Mr. Blue. He funds these wars, he boasts that he will ‘take care’ of us during these difficult times. He is the making of a dictator without the official political power of a dictator.
^A lot of people blame him for everything.
^I’m just reiterating what I’ve heard and seen with my own eyes. I’m not saying it’s true, at least in its entirety.
^But, I mean, it seems to me that’s the case right?
^Yes, but he didn’t just pop up overnight and make hell on earth.
^The seeds of this disaster were sown a long time ago.
^And then a rich guy comes in and says he’s going to fix everything.
^And he’s charming and cool and everyone loves him.
^they turn a blind eye to where his money goes.
^Of course, it’s not going to last forever.
^Tell Tali not to wait for me.
^I’m suprised she’s even out, surely she should be a bit more cautious considering who her father is.
^Then again, he’s always had a very lax attitude when it comes to his kids.
^It’s an adjustment, when you realise despite your money and power, you can still be vulnerable.
^I think when you’re at that level of wealth, you start thinking you’re untouchable.
^And it’s perhaps rather humbling, to know that you’re not.
^The dirt kind of just got swept under the carpet after I spoke to Lavender.
^I think my boss still has a grudge against me.
^Hasn’t suggested that I take on managing the server or any other responsibilities.
^In practice, it’s made things a bit awkward.
^He’s moved on to suggesting another colleague do the extra work instead.
^They asked me to back them up.
^You’re going to stand up for your fellow worker and make sure your employer doesn’t force them into unpaid labour riight??
^It’s just that Lavender fought really hard to make her dad ask my boss to get off my case.
^And now, rocking the boat so soon after that. It feels wrong.

^I get it. But what’s to say he won’t do it again. And you can’t rely on Lavender’s support forever. What about your fellow workers? Don’t they also have a right to feeling comfortable in the workplace.
^I’ve kind of been thinking about this lately to be honest.
^She’s the only person I’ve been able to rely on in my whole entire life.
^That was not where I thought that was going.
^Look, Tali. I like you. So I’m going to be real with you.
^I’ve already upset one person today. So I think I might as well kill two birds with one stone.
^And I don’t think you’re using that proverb correctly.
^Tali, I think you need other friends.
^Well, of course you’re going to think that. You don’t like Lavender.
^I’m not going to even try and deny it.
^But the problem is not that she’s your friend. It’s that she’s your only friend.
^A friend you rely on, for employment and to solve any problem in your life. You can’t have a healthy relationship like that. There’s an obvious power imbalance here.
^Are you saying I can’t be friends with her because she’s a billionaire and I’m poor?

^I’m not saying that exactly… I’m just saying that she lives in a completely different reality to you, to us to anyone you’ve ever known. She could drop you on a whim and feel a little sad maybe. But you would be ruined.

^I do think that sometimes, it really sucks. She’s helped me out so much. She supported me when I came out to my parents. She let me live in her apartment during uni when I couldn’t afford rent. She helped me with the deposit on my current flat. She helped me get my current job, though her father, she fixes any issues I have with my boss when I need. If I have an emergency, she’s the one I know I can turn to but she’s the only one.
^Do you speak to your parents anymore?
^I speak to my sister sometimes, but she’s…I don’t want to get too close to her because I worry if I do, my parents will be upset with her because of her association with me.
^I don’t want to fuck up her life.
^How can they be that angry that they’d blame a child for associating with you.
^My family runs this little restaurant. It's been passed down for 5 generations.
^My parents have dedicated their lives to the restaurant.
^I remember when I was a kid.
^Doing my homework behind the counter while my mum served the customers.
^It was a big part of my life, I guess. I didn't realise it until I left home.
^But, you see we kind of have this tradition that the place is left to the oldest son. And they are meant to take over from the father.
^And you see, there are two problems with that.
^Number one: I am a woman. And number two: I have no interest in restaurants, or producing food or anything customer service related.
^I'm a total introvert, and I can barely boil an egg. I have no desire to serve people food or manage a business.
^And this is the worst thing that could have happened to my parents. To know that their tradition is broken. That I will not be the person they want me to.
^But your sister could take over maybe.
^Unfortunately, she is a girl, so it will probably go to my cousin.
^I have one who is a boy, and a business graduate so my parents will leave it to him to keep up the tradition at least.
^They would rather leave it to their nephew, than their daughter just because she's a woman.
^It's dumb. Unfortunately these biases still exist. They think she will marry someone and he will take the business. So somehow everything will be ruined.

^And we are here for such a short time. And we cling onto these stupid things in the hopes that they will make us happy. It comforts my parents to imagine that one day, when they are gone, their descendants will prosper in the success of our family restaurant. They do not know these future people, they will never meet them but they are already more real than I am.
^Their potential existence has given them more solace than I ever will.
^I dislike making assumptions about people I haven't met.
^But I can't say these people have made a particularly good impression on me. At least from your description of them.
^I didn’t mean to make this into a whole sob story.
^My point is that things are not as simple and easy as they seem to be. Although I know you mean well.
^I really must have foot in mouth syndrome today.
^I suppose you could afford to be a little more tactful.
^I have always wondered what’s going on in her head though.
^It’s none of our business, that’s what it is.
^Maybe it was good for her to get that off her chest. It’s…difficult sometimes, keeping it all inside.
^That being said, it was not your job to cajole it out of her.
^I didn’t cajole anything out of her. I just offered her an opinion, and she spilled her truth to us.
^I didn’t make her say anything she didn’t want to.
^He’s got a point Pan, maybe he wasn’t so polite, but sometimes it’s how these things go.
^I know you’re very sensitive to these kinds of things.
^Friction. Like any time you see people arguing or agitated, I see your whole body prickle.
^Or whatever the android equivalent of prickling is. You tense up. Your eyes stop fluttering. You stop breathing. It’s like you stop pretending to—
^The breathing is just my cooling system at work. If my eyes flutter it’s a reflex from my body language translation software.
^I am programmed to do that to make humans at ease, the same way my voice is modulated to communicate information in a calm, efficient manner.

^I know you didn’t. It’s just a touchy topic. Everyone assumes we want to be human, or we want to fully assimilate with the humans. We are fully aware we are not human, and most of us do not dream of becoming one. We have our purpose and we know our place.
^It’s just so strange that everyone thinks that is what we want.
^Hmm, maybe you could tell me that story some time.
^Eh, it’s not really my cup of tea.
read_alice_in_wonderland: ^Hehe, you shouldn't be spending money on me
^So will you read it to me?
^*For a moment you feel at peace*
^Well, you shouldn't really just drink or eat random things you find in strange places
^But you know, what if it's like a really tasty piece of cake, or a really nice drink?
^I can't be poisoned, so I don't have to worry
^I'm joking, I don't go around eating abandoned food
^But Alice is a kid, kids do that kind of thing
^I will continue this tonight, I want to see what happens
^Perhaps she will have to have her stomach pumped later on
^I reacharge, I only need to do so for about four hours though
^So you've got the rest of the night to enjoy yourself
read_greek_myths: ^*As you do so a sense of calm fills the room*
^If he'd just did as his father said he wouldn't have fallen to his death
^So we should all do as we're told
^Uh no, I think the story is more about the dangers of pride
^It's not suggesting we never question authority
^But if he'd just listened to his father
^No worries, I promise there are better stories in there
read_howls_moving_castle: ^*You feel tranquility fill your very being*
^Well you could have had adopted siblings
^It must be nice I think, to have a family like that.
^I can't wait to finish this tonight.
togue_1: ^I found one of the magazines you like.
togue_2: ^Just before I forget, I ordered this spring addition for you.
^Well, I suppose you're not completely useless.
togue_3: ^Just before I forget, I ordered this for you.
^Well, I suppose you're not completely useless.
togue_winter: ^Oh Lavender, I have a Togue winter addition for you.
^Oh my, I never thought I'd see it.
togue_special: ^So Lavender, I have a Togue special issue for you.
^There's a silver dress I wanted to try and replicate.
^Not really. But if it makes you happy.
fantasy_dragon_heart_book: ^You ordered this for me? n Thanks, I'll take it.n Although I'm not sure if I'll have time to read it for a while now.
fantasy_7_book: ^Sweet! The seventh book is just what I needed to complete my collection

^Well, it's kind of complicated but the whole series is about these seven monarchs who need to find these enchanted weapons to battle each other to fight this epic battle to see who will be the ruler of all the kingdoms.
^Who decided fighting a big battle was a good idea?
^It was prophesied long ago, each book focuses on one of the moncharchs. The last book will conclude with the battle.
the_sentinel: ^It's about this guy who lives in a lighthouse, and he looks out for these monsters that crawl out of the sea at night.
^What does he do to the monsters?
giraffe_woman: ^Woah you got the first issue of Giraffewoman, that's something.
zebra_man: ^Shit you did it! Zebraman 89, not a good one, but very impressive nonetheless
wildfyre: ^I found this comic called Wildfyre, is it any good?
^Where there is this disease called Wildfyre
^When a person gets it they go crazy
^And then sort of combust from the inside out
^It's kind of horror, it's pretty dark
^So the governments develop this weapon called the world destroyer
^It's designed to wipe out the world
^It would put everyone out of their misery
^All the governemnts of the world have to agree for it to detonate
^But none of the governments are brave enough to use it
^They're only meant to trigger it when they've lost all hope
^I don't like the sound of this comic very much
^But I might give it another try one day
blackgoat: ^I got this book I thought you might like, it's highly recommend apparently.
^Oh, yes, this is The Black Goat.
^This child is born to a member of the cult and she's half human half goat.
^They keep her trapped in a house, and abuse her, and force her to drink human blood.
^She finally gets the courage during a ceremony she murders the whole cult.
^And it's about her journey I guess being a monster that will never fit in with the human world.
^And exploring if someone like that can ever experience joy.
^No, I just read about it in a review.
hypnos: ^Wait a minute, just before you go.
^I have something you might be interested in.
^This is cool, I was looking for this issue.
^Just a reimagining of him and stories centered around his...
^I thought it would be something dark and dystopian.
^This guy insults him and he gives the man insomnia and he dies after begging Hypnos to let him sleep.
^And in another story a king insults him and he puts his daughter, the princess, to sleep for thirty years.
^He only wakes her up when she's middle aged, and her youth has passed her by.
^That's pretty lighthearted compared to most of the stuff you read.
c_questions_t: ^What did you want to be when you were younger?
^I think I have become an artist in a way, I create beautiful webpages.
^You know what, yes it totally is.
^I wish I could see your art.
^Even then she was so secretive, always guarding her sketchbook.
c_questions_k: ^Why do I feel like you're the villain and I've just walked into your secret base of criminal operations.
^I can't be held responsible for your overactive imagination.
^OK, I'm going to brew a mega tea, a combination of all the different teas that Pandora has in the kitchen. And I want you to drink it all.
^You will gain the ability to see in the dark.
^I may gain the ability to empty the contents of my stomach onto this floor.
^Ok. I may retract my original dare.
^Kent can throw up in there if he feels sick.
^And put all the teas into the cup.
^The good thing is that this tea already looks like someone's been sick in it, so it won't be a surprise when it comes back the other way.
^Why did you have to say that?
^No, that will just make things worse.
^Dilutes the tea, but this thing isn't going to taste good anyway.
^I'm about to throw this concoction in your face if you don't shut up.
^Yuck, don't you dare. Just the smell is making me nauseous.
^Damn Cas, I thought you were my friend.
^I didn't realise it would be that bad.
c_questions_p: ^I just want to see how you do it.
^She can just power down like that.
^I mean, you can just adjust your body to fit your own needs. Endlessly.
^If androids had more rights, it would be pretty sweet to be one.
^Ok guys, I feel like you're going to do break into song in a minute, and I don't know how I feel about that. Pandora, please wake up.
^I remember Ada told me, I need to press this button if she doesn't start up naturally.
^I mean organical-if she doesn't wake up on her own. You know what I mean.
^Oh my god, she thinks she slept the whole night.
^I remember what's going on, I'm just joking.
c_questions_l: ^What did you think of Tali when you met her?
^Until I got to know her...and then I realised.
^You're not going to say anything to defend yourself?
l_questions_t: ^You know everything about me anyway. What's the point of truth?
^Try carrying as many books as possible.
^Probably not for the books at least.
^There are probably some crappy books no one cares about.
^Oh shit. I forgot I'm in charge.
^Just let me know when you're going to fold. Me and Pan can probably catch them if they fall.
^You're just giving me the little books.
^And Pandora is the one giving ME the little books.
^Well, those are the less valuable ones. And they're less likely to get damaged if they fall.
^Does it really matter how big the books are?
^I don't want anyone to say I was cheating.
^OK. What do you want? The Lord of the Rings, War and Peace, University Physics with Modern Physics 14th Edition by Hugh D. Young, Roget A. Freedman...
^Stop talking in uppercase. It's very rude.
^Sure did, hit you in the shoulder and bounced into my arms.
l_questions_k: ^Of course there is, there's always a Keith.
^How did you get a job at Calamity?
^You turn up wearing a suit and you entertain a bunch of wankers for an hour or two. And then you sign your life away.
^Hold on a minute...YOU wore a suit?
^Ok, now tell me what actually happened.
^The whole point of this is that you open up and share details about your life, is it not?
^Well, I want to hear this story too.
^Also, she called me 'Your Honour' I'm an easy woman to please.
^My boss was had a medical emergency.
^And my boyfriend, Scott, was the one in the ambulance with him.
^So they were talking and he mentions that he works for the Calamity.
^And Scott starts talking about me, I was freelancing at the time as an illustrator.
^Who knows, his hair implants fell out probably.
^If you worked for him, you wouldn't be so appreciative either.
^And I give him high quality drawings under a tight deadline.
^The quality of your drawings is debatable.
l_questions_p: ^Ok, so as an android, do you have feelings?
^Sorry Lavender, what do you mean by that?
^Feel-ings. Things that you feel. Sadness. Happiness. Fear.
^I have transmitters in my brain that tell me when which of these emotions should take precident. Much like how you have chemicals in yours.
^I mean it's like someone's telling you how to feel.

^Not really, just like an infant I started off with a basic blueprint, and then I started learning that certain inputs triggered certain responses and I thought about what to do with that information and my brain made connections. Then it used these emotions as a guideline to make me perform these specific tasks when I need to.
^It's not an exact science of course.
l_questions_c: ^I dare you to tell me your deepest darkest secret.
^I don't know, it's up to you to figure that out.
^And also is it physically possible? Like how much do you weigh.
^Never ask a lady about her weight.
^Also, I should weigh the same as an average human woman of the same stature as myself.
^And I wouldn't mind you lifting me for the purpose of this game at least.
^Hey, be careful! You're going to damage my circuits.
^It's not like you're made of tissue paper.
^It's over now. I don't think I like being carried.
^It makes me feel like a dog.
p_questions_t: ^You can pinch me if you like.
^I'm sorry, I didn't realise the pinch would cause so much drama.
^Oh come on now. That's a lie. You live for the drama Pandora.
p_questions_k: ^I dare you to fold the corner of a page of your favourite comic book.
^Ok ok, how about folding the corner of your oldest most worn comic book.
^You work in a bookstore. I was hoping you'd be more of a bibliophile.
^And anyway, I'm not as sentimental as you.
^There. I did it. I folded the corner of the page.
p_questions_l: ^I don't mean to offend you with this question.
^What I mean is just not to offend you.
^Why do you dress the way you do?
^Well, unlike what most people think it's not to draw attention to myself.
^And it's not because I'm trying to make pedos like me or something.
^Which is really gross. I hate when people try to make that argument.
^It's different, I feel like myself when I put on puffy skirts and pink bows.
^I'm not trying to look sexy, or put together. I just look like myself.
^When did you start dressing like that?
^Maybe around twenty two. I didn't start dressing exclusively like this until twenty four.
^In school at around sixteen I started noticing guys looking at me differently, treating me differently and it made me uncomfortable.
^I tried a lot of different styles, but it always felt like I was trying to be someone else. Someone mature and sophisticated.
^I'm not that person, I never will be. I'm just silly, and I want to dress silly.
^I'm so glad for you. Thank you for sharing that with us.
^And you made me say a lot about my past.
^You're trying to psychoanalyse me, aren't you?
^It's free therapy, take it while you can.
^Wow I feel all warm and fuzzy inside.
^I wasn't actually trying to therapise you, I was just curious.
^Do you have any ideas about where your suspicion stems from?
^Ha! I'm not falling for that one.
^If you're going to therapise me, I'm going to have to pay you first.
p_questions_c: ^I suppose I'll ask my lovely colleague.
^You go to the front, I'll sit at the counter.
^You don't know how to work that thing.
^How much damage can she do anyway?
^You're telling me you've never sat in that seat before?
^Ok, I get it. I'm a control freak. Now can I have my counter back.
